intro: Alsinella trinervis, commonly known as the narrow-veined alsinella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and coastal areas. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, feathery appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. Alsinella trinervis is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
